data.title: Txcity
data.description:
**About:**
Txcity.io is a blockchain visualization tool.

[Txcity](https://txcity.io/)

About Txcity: A cutting-edge tool for visualizing blockchain transactions, provides a unique, real-time perspective on the LU network (Coming Soon). It transforms complex blockchain data into an intuitive, interactive visual format, making it easier to understand and analyze the intricate world of digital transactions. Ideal for stakeholders seeking deeper insights into blockchain activities. You can explore more about this tool by visiting https://txcity.io is a blockchain transaction visualiser.

What you see on Txcity?

The bus is block in the blockchain.
The animated character is a transaction on the blockchain network, you can click on it and view all details of the transactions. The house on the streets are dApps on blockchain, you can view transactions coming out from the house (dApp) Current Status Currently implemented this system on size different blockchains.

Currently, we have 2k unique daily users visits (not bots) on website.
- Currently running 7 chains - **#ETH #BTC #BCH #LTC #LUKSO #XMR #ARBI**
- Upcoming Chains: **#CELO #MANTA #DASH #OP #BASE**
data.problem:
**Problem Statement 1**
New dApps on blockchain struggle onboarding users and creating awareness about their dApps due to few dApps having control and presence in the entire market.

As per dAppRadar.com and DefiLama.com there are
Nearly 3k defi dApps with only top 100 dApps having transaction volume over 100k USD while TVL(Total Value Locked) is over $1 billion USD for only first 15 dApps.
The situation with Gaming dApps is more worst as there are only top 10 dApps with more than 50k transaction volume out of 2500 dApps aprox.

**Problem Statement 2**
Blockchain & DeFI service companies have millions of registered users on their chain, yet their daily active accounts are just a fraction of the total, undermining revenue growth.
data.solution:
- Helps new users in the space understand the workings of blockchain by visualization and educating them more about dApps and Blockchains.
- Gives bird’s view of pending blockchain transactions (mempool).
user interface to blockchains which is both
fun and intuitive for all users
- Real-time access to complex blockchain data
through a user friendly interface
- Interactive, character-based animations which
enhances user understanding and interpretation of
complex blockchain transaction data
- For a fraction of the traditional costs:
significant ROI with reduced investments

**Upcoming Features**: 

- Visualisation of Bridges

Check out the bridge visualisation for ETH <> LUKSO (DEMO, will launching End of Aug) - https://x.com/web3dopamine/status/1811710863432409514

- Character activation 
Where wallet is represented as character rather than cryptographic keys
Where user can navigate, transfer, receive and interact with dApps on chain
data.missionSummary:
- Our vision of the future is one of onchain literacy - with people around the world connecting via new economic opportunities.
- By making Blockchain readable, we're revealing to everyone what it truly is.
- Promoting Onchain literacy which is freedom.

data.name: OpenCivics
data.description:
This OpenCivics Consortium Round seeks to fund critical collaborative protocols, prototypes, and infrastructures that enable civic engagement and interoperable civic utilities for direct governance and stewardship of our communities and commons. We see these collaborative methods and prototypes as critically underfunded force multipliers for multi-agent coordination on key systemic leverage points that create deep social change. 

Ideal applicants will be engaged in developing technology, applied research, and social processes related to collaboration and coordination for collective action. Projects may address the diverse stack of collaborative protocols needed for successful multi-agent coordination such as: identity and attestation, on-chain delegation and roles, decentralized project management, fundraising and allocation, systems-aware strategic alignment processes, measurement and evaluation, and participatory governance and learning. These efforts may be theoretical and research-based or may be applied contexts of collaboration whose successful actualization could lead to protocolization of key activities and collaborative functions.  

For additional definitions and application details, please visit https://go.opencivics.co/wiki

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
TxCity.io is an open-source, real-time blockchain transaction visualizer that brings transparency, education, and engagement to blockchain data. Our project contributes to the OSS ecosystem in three key ways:

Open Access to Multi-Chain Transaction Visualization
TxCity supports multiple blockchains and we’re continuously adding more. By open-sourcing our visualization engine, anyone can fork or extend our codebase to support additional chains, build educational tools, or create their own versions of transaction explorers.

Onboarding New Developers with Accessible UI/UX
Most blockchain explorers are data heavy and intimidating for newcomers. TxCity makes blockchain approachable through gamified, character based visualizations turning every transaction into a story. This inspires OSS developers, educators, and hackers to experiment with blockchain data in creative ways

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
TxCity.io is a real-time blockchain transaction visualizer that transforms raw data into an immersive, animated city experience. Each transaction becomes a character, each block becomes a bus, and the entire network activity unfolds like a living, breathing digital city.

Key Features & Use Cases:
Real-Time Transaction Visualization
Users can watch live on-chain activity as animated characters board buses (blocks), making blockchain activity tangible and engaging.

Multi-Chain Support
TxCity already supports 10 chains with more chains onboarding. It’s a multi chain explorer that visualizes cross-chain activity in one consistent interface.

Gamified Learning & Education
Designed for both developers and non-technical users, TxCity is used by educators and community managers to demystify blockchain helping users understand how wallets, smart contracts, and transactions interact.

Onboarding & Ecosystem Growth Tool
Protocols and chains use TxCity to showcase activity, attract new users, and promote transparency. It helps communities celebrate their chain’s vibrancy in a fun, visual way.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
TxCity.io is just getting started. Our roadmap focuses on expanding both technical capabilities and community impact:

Support for More Blockchains
We plan to onboard Base, Avalanche, Polygon, and Optimism, making TxCity the go-to visualization hub for both EVM and non-EVM chains.

Wallet-Level Storytelling
We’re developing features to visualize wallet histories — showing how individual addresses interact with others over time, enabling deeper insight for researchers, community managers, and everyday users.

Open APIs & Embeddable Widgets
We aim to release developer-friendly APIs and embeddable visual components so other projects can integrate TxCity’s visualizations into their own dashboards or educational tools.

Enhanced Analytics & Stats Dashboards
We're working on detailed chain-specific stats — such as top wallets, contract interactions, and trending assets — all visualized in a more accessible and engaging way.

Community-Driven Visual Themes
We want to open-source the visual themes engine, allowing communities to customize how their chain or project looks within TxCity — think meme-driven art styles, seasonal events, and more.

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.
questions.explanation: TxCity.io does not currently deploy or rely on smart contracts. All data is retrieved from blockchain nodes via RPC/WebSocket endpoints and processed off-chain through our custom infrastructure.
